stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.

Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.

stadium.name: The Buccaneer's Bowl
stadium.description: A flashy, pristine stadium built on a private beach exclusively for resort guests. The field is imported turf, and a massive, puppet kraken in the bay entertains the crowd at halftime.

stats.pregame_ritual: Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Painting their teeth with a mixture of charcoal and water.
Doing a series of loud, guttural breathing exercises.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.

preGame:
Well, hello there, sports fans and soul-traders! It‚Äôs a gorgeous, blood-splattered Tuesday night, and we are coming to you live from the Prismatic Pavilion for the absolute pinnacle of desperation! I‚Äôm your host, Nok the Corrupter, and boy oh boy, do we have a real humdinger for you tonight! It‚Äôs Game 3 of the Losers Bracket playoffs‚Äîthe tiebreaker, the decider, the final nail in someone‚Äôs coffin! The series is locked at one-all between the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres and the Tortell Privateers, and the tension over this lagoon is thicker than a swamp-hag's stew! üèüÔ∏èüåä

Down on the colorful stage-planks, the players are getting into their grooves! I just saw Keisling Damalas of the Privateers finishing up his charcoal tooth-painting‚Äîthat man‚Äôs grin is enough to curdling milk at fifty paces! On the other side, Melesa Zelten is leading the Bizarres in a chant that‚Äôs getting so loud it‚Äôs shaking the stilts of this stadium! And look at Dib Tufts, just finishing off a raw egg, shell and all! Now that‚Äôs what I call a breakfast of champions! These athletes are ready to give their all, mostly because in the Everwar, they don't have a choice! ü•öüíÄ

The crowd is absolutely roaring, though I suspect half of them are just hoping to see a 'hero' like that ringleader Kython get knocked into the drink. The footing is unstable, the sun is reflecting off the lagoon, and the Privateers are looking to pillage their way into the next round! Will the Bizarres' theatrical flair be enough to overcome the raw, unadulterated violence of the Privateers? Grab your grog and hold onto your souls, because the winner stays in the dance, and the loser is going home in a bucket! It‚Äôs time for Trollball! üé≠üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è
postGame:
Holy smokes, what a spectacular display of organized carnage! The dust has settled over the Starlight Lagoon, and we have our winner! The Starlight Bazaar Bizarres have defended their home turf with a 2-0 victory, taking this Best of 3 series and sending the Tortell Privateers packing! It was a defensive masterclass, provided your definition of 'defense' includes sending your opponents to the infirmary with alarming regularity! üèüÔ∏è‚ú®

The action started with a bang as Keisling Damalas snagged the troll head in Center Field, but the Bizarres were not about to let the Privateers settle in. Aggri Cookie decided that Dib Tufts had been standing for far too long, delivering a bone-crunching tackle that sent Dib straight to the healer! It‚Äôs a shame about that raw egg he ate; I bet it didn't stay down for long! üöëü•ö

Not to be outdone, Willa Lois showed us exactly why she carries that dagger! She caught Ellan Elburt mid-stride and delivered an injury so beautiful it nearly brought a tear to my eye. The Privateers were dropping like flies in the early going, and even the resort guests at the Buccaneer's Bowl could probably hear the cracks of impact from across the water! üè•üí•

But the Privateers had some fight in them yet! Lilithe Royce, showing that classic Privateer grit, targeted Gagliano Tallbott. She didn't just tackle him; she dismantled him, sending the Bizarres' funnyman to the sidelines for a bit of quiet reflection with the healer. It was a lovely bit of retaliation that kept the fans on the edge of their unstable seats! üëäü§°

Then came the moment that defined the match! Melesa Zelten, clearly fueled by that pre-game chanting, found himself in Home Field with the troll head. He didn't hesitate for a second, launching a magnificent Shoot that sailed through the goal for 2 points! The crowd erupted, and I‚Äôm fairly certain the lagoon splash reached the nosebleed section! That was the only score of the game, but it was all the Bizarres needed! üéØüî•

Halftime couldn't come fast enough for the Privateers. The healers were working overtime, patching up leathery skin and resetting limbs. It was a brief moment of peace in an otherwise delightful evening of trauma. I saw some of the 'heroes' of the realm, like that money-priest Brennen Farno, looking quite uncomfortable with the level of violence‚Äîhonestly, someone should tell those Guild of the Black Sky types that Trollball isn't for the faint of heart! üí∞ü©π

In the second half, Dib Tufts returned to the field like a man possessed! He clearly had a grudge to settle, and he settled it twice over! First, he absolutely leveled Bush Heiner, and then, for an encore, he sent Demp Chet to the dirt! If only the rest of the Privateers had shown that kind of initiative, we might be looking at a different scoreline. It was a one-man wrecking crew performance! üõ†Ô∏èüò§

The Bizarres' defense was like a cursed vault for the rest of the match. Every time the Privateers tried to make a move, they were met with a wall of halberds and broadswords. Goldberg Tova tried to spark a comeback with a long pass, but it was read like a children's book by Quintessa Austine, who snagged the interception and dashed any remaining Privateer hopes! üîêintercept

I must say, seeing the Privateers fail to score a single point in the deciding game is almost as satisfying as watching Sir Garon Ironrock try to figure out a revolving door. The Bizarres played with the coordination of a well-oiled machine‚Äîor at least a machine that‚Äôs been spiked with cheap ale and a desire for glory! üé≠üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è

So, the series ends 2-1 in favor of the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres! They move on in the Losers Bracket, while the Tortell Privateers are left to lick their wounds and wonder where it all went wrong. Probably right around the time they decided to stop blocking and start falling down! üèñÔ∏èüíÄ

What a night of sport, what a night of blood! I haven't seen this much theatrical pain since the last time someone tried to audit the Prismatic Troupe‚Äôs taxes! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from a night of beautiful, chaotic Trollball! Remember, folks: it‚Äôs not whether you win or lose, it‚Äôs how many people you take to the healer with you! Stay brutal, Osterra! üíÄ‚ú®
